result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Gerald Schoville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Benjamin Gerald Schoville in court with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  GUILTY plea.  PSI waived.
SWH 2 yrs PROBATION - zero credit days.  AODA, any other.  Absolute sobriety.  $528 costs due DOC.
